alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 17 at 10:41PM EDT by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT JEFFERSON COUNTY THROUGH 1115 PM EDT... At 1040 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Vernon, moving southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Madison, Hanover, Saluda, Smyrna, Kent, Dupont, Wakefield, Middlefork, Canaan and Volga. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
